conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls are extruded with visible thickness, multiple faces per wall are visible, and the interior is shown from an elevated angled/isometric viewpoint with the roof/ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and room volume; clean cutaway and readable corners. Minor simplification of some wall intersections/openings and slight perspective/scale stylization.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout reads consistent with the plan segment (kitchen adjacent to dining/open area; utility/HVAC core and nearby WC; bay/window zone at right). Some wall lengths/partition placements appear approximated, and several opening locations/sizes are not verifiably exact relative to the dense 2D dimensioning.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen counters/appliances and bathroom fixtures are present; some generic furniture exists. Several rooms appear under-furnished or simplified, limiting confident room-by-room identity matching.

visual_clarity.notes: High readability of walls/floors and good lighting. Minor presentation/UI contamination via embedded floor text labels (e.g., HVAC/W) and some low-contrast areas reducing opening clarity.

detected_errors.description: Noticeable simplification/approximation of certain partition placements and proportional wall lengths compared to the tightly dimensioned 2D plan segment.
Door/window exact positions and sizes do not appear to fully match the 2D plan (some openings look shifted or generalized).
Text labels embedded in the 3D view (e.g., HVAC/W) reduce presentation cleanliness.

summary: A genuine and coherent 3D cutaway conversion with strong spatial depiction, but with some proportional/layout and opening-placement approximations versus the 2D plan.
